title: 820-3332 no video
message:
820-3332 had no video at first. Heated GPU some and video returned. After GPU replacement I had chime backlight and video again but red distortion in the background and osx wouldn't fully load. At first reflowed VRAM but then no video. After reballing all vrams I still have no backlight or video but it still chimes.

Not missing any components around vram.  Could the vram gone bad or possibly something else? Also applied leaded solder to U8900 to rule it out but no change

title: 820-3332 no video
message: Did you try U8900 first? Did you remove the VRAM glue when doing the GPU?

title: 820-3332 no video
message:
Yes tried U8900 first.

Did not remove glue from vram before GPU replacement which is why I  reballed them afterwards when i noticed the red artifacts

title: 820-3332 no video
message: If Samsung vRAM, probably got bad...

title: 820-3332 no video
message: Yeah could be bad VRAM now

title: 820-3332 no video
message: Hynix VRAM. Will try new Vram

title: 820-3332 no video
message: All VRAM was replaced along with U8900 but still no image or backlight on screen and 0V on PPVCORE_GPU

title: 820-3332 no video
message: Bad GPU bad VRAM bad CPU bad internal trace. Sounds like a waste of time.
